= Description =

This demo illustrates devices interaction while using FRSync Arduino library. 

http://rfsync.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/RF2400.png

===Characters===

  * Client
  * Server 
  * Observer


===Act===

  # *Client* puts in common data array, system time information.
  # *Server* takes from common data array information and put it in another position.
  # *Client* takes time information from another position (where it was placed by server), compare it with current time and calculate time that synchronization takes.
  # All synchronization processes observes by the *Observer* 


= Hardware =

  * [http://www.inhaos.com/product_info.php?products_id=35 RF-2400P module] - 2 pieces
  * [http://arduino.cc Arduino board] - 2 pieces
  * [http://www.inhaos.com/product_info.php?products_id=42 RF-2410U dongle]  - 1 piece
  * [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_computer PC] running on [http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows/home  Microsoft Windows] - 1 piece

= Software =

  * RFSync Arduino [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/files/RFSync_0-01.zip library]
  * Arduino [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ArduinoLibrary/RFSync/examples/RFSync_client/RFSync_client.ino sketch] for the *Client*
  * Arduino [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ArduinoLibrary/RFSync/examples/RFSync_server/RFSync_server.ino sketch] for the *Server*
  * [Drivers Drivers] for RF-2410U 
  * [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/files/RF2410U%20RFSYNC%200_01.hex RF-2410U firmware]
  * [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/files/RF2410U%20Loader.zip RF-2410U loader] application.
  * *Observer* [http://rfsync.googlecode.com/files/RFSyncSetup_0-01.msi client application].

= Assembly instruction =

===Client & Server===

  # Connect RF-2400P modules to Arduino boards using next [Schematic connection diagram].
  # Set up RFSync library on Arduino IDE.
  # Download client and server sketches on arduino boards.

===Observer===

  # Install drivers.
  # Run Loader application and update firmware on RF-2410U dongle
  # Install and run Observer client application.

= Running demo =

  # Power up the arduino boards.
  # Look at the devices interaction process using UART interface.
  # Press "Start" button in the observer application.
  # Look at the devices interaction in the observer application console.
